data.title: Valencia College
data.meta_description: Valencia was named the best two-year college in the United States as the inaugural winner of the Aspen Prize for Community College Excellence. Valencia has one...
data.text:
Why Come to Valencia College?

Valencia was named the best two-year college in the United States as the inaugural winner of the Aspen Prize for Community College Excellence. Valencia has one of the highest graduation rates in the country and provides guaranteed admission to one of the 12 four-year Florida state universities, including the University of Central Florida.

Whether your goal is to transfer to a four-year university, complete a career program, or simply improve your English, Valencia has the solution for you. With over 100 degree programs to choose from, and an Intensive English Program, Valencia will provide you with an excellent educational experience. Our international student services team will support your needs with advising, workshops, programming opportunities and a chance to meet new friends.

Fully accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS)

Seneff Honors College for high achieving students

Small class sizes and dedicated faculty

Comprehensive Intensive English Program – accepts all levels of English

Affordable tuition – 40% less than at a state university

Academic support, including libraries, labs, writing center and tutoring

Dedicated international student advisors and counselors

More than 100 nations represented within Valencia’s student body

On-campus housing available at Downtown Campus

Location

Orlando is located in the center of Florida, midway between Jacksonville and Miami. The St. Petersburg-Tampa area on the Gulf of Mexico and Daytona Beach on the Atlantic Ocean are easy drives.Valencia College is located in Orlando, Florida, USA. With seven campus locations, the college is close to downtown Orlando, the Orlando International Airport, the University of Central Florida and world-famous theme parks and beaches.

What Orlando Has to Offer?

Home to Walt Disney World® Resort, Universal Studios Florida®, and SeaWorld®

Art, culture, entertainment and nightlife

Beaches, public parks, springs and lakes for outdoor activities

Sports teams including the Orlando Magic basketball, UCF Knights college football, Orlando City soccer and baseball spring training for the Atlanta Braves and Houston Astros

Home to internationally recognized companies including Darden Restaurants, Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman and Electronic Arts

Becoming a national leader in health care and biotechnology

Average annual temperature of 72.4F/22.4C degrees

Intensive English Program

We accept students at all language levels from beginner to advance. Students interested in a degree program at Valencia who need to improve their English can start with the Intensive English Program and then transfer into a Valencia degree program. This program is accredited by the Commission on English Language Program Accreditation (CEA) which is recognized by the U.S. Secretary of Education as a national accrediting agency for English Language Programs and institutions in the U.S.

Monthly start dates

Small class sizes

A variety of social and cultural activities

Dedicated international student advisor

Conditional acceptance to Valencia College

Based on their level, students can study anywhere from two weeks to over one year

Transfer from the Intensive English Program to a Degree Program without taking an English proficiency exam

For more information, go to valenciacollege.edu/iep

Degree and Career Programs

Valencia offers over 100 programs, including two and four year degrees.

General Studies

Arts and Entertainment

Business

Communications

Education

Engineering, Computer Programming, and Technical Programs

Health Sciences

Horticulture and Landscape

Hospitality and Culinary

Information Technology

Public Safety and Legal

Science and Mathematics

Social Sciences

How to Apply

Valencia College accepts new degree-seeking students each semester—fall, spring and summer. International students are encouraged to submit their online application as soon as possible in order to complete all application requirements by the desired admission date.

To access the online application and view the complete steps to apply, please visit our website for the steps to apply international.valenciacollege.edu/admissions.

Requirements:

Online Application with fee of $35 USD

High School Transcripts

Results from the TOEFL, IELTS, LOEP or Duolingo English Test (if applicable)

Declaration of Finances

Copy of passport

Recommended Application Dates

Intensive English Program: Monthly start dates allow students to apply at any time.

Degree Programs:

Fall: June 15th

Spring: October 15th

Summer: March 15th

Scholarship

Valencia College offers scholarships exclusively for international students. There are three Global Achievers Awards - one for new freshman international students, one for transfer international students, and one for students who started in the Valencia College Intensive English program.The award amounts range from $500 to $2,500 USD and are based on merit achievement. The awards are nonrenewable and applied to the first term tuition. For details please go to our international students webpage and search for scholarships.

Eligibility

Must submit a Valencia College application for admission and all required application materials as stated on the international student webpage

Submit the scholarship application on the Valencia College international student webpage including two essay questions

Plans to enroll as an F-1 visa international student

Submits materials by the deadline established

Must take full time courses equivalent to at least 12 credit hours in the first semester.

Review additional requirements for each individual award at https://international.valenciacollege.edu/tuition-installment-plan/scholarships/
